node.description: The ash-laden air chokes the village green with its pallid dwellings, each in desperate need of repair. Guttering lanterns cast strange, shifting patterns of light and shadow over the small sward as their light is cast over the gnarled, barren trees and splintered wooden benches at its center. Tattered curtains flutter in a broken window nearby, while weathered kegs litter the landing of a crumbling mining depot. Some mossy stone steps collapse downward into the darkness towards small lake nearby, a distant towering shadow barely visible between the homes.

node.name: Dirge, Hawthorn Lane
node.description: Entombed by tall weeds, the decomposing skeleton of a termite-riddled gazebo serves as a haunting reminder of the forsaken neighborhood's lost splendor. Along with the ruins of the local stables, several homes line the dark cobblestone lane, lit only by the light from an occasional window. Iron-banded kegs are stacked along many of the sagging porches, while a withering pumpkin patch divides several of the buildings. A trio of collapsed mining carts teeters upon the iron rails that run throughout the community.

node.description: A scant few lanterns reveal the dilapidated homes that crowd one side of the narrow lane, a stained and broken doll peeking out from beneath the overgrown shrubbery. Across the road, a considerable amount of trees have been cleared, providing several cords of firewood and unorganized stacks of cumbrous shoring beams. Near a broad stump pierced by a long-handled axe, a small wooden cart lies toppled to one side, one of its wheels collapsed beneath it.

node.name: Dirge, Hawthorn Lane
node.description: Rising out of the surrounding darkness, several surviving blackberry bushes threaten to choke off the short bend in the roadway, their redolent scents sweetening the evening air. Stacked stone piles rise amid dried weeds, placed like markers among the many homes that line the narrow cobblestone lane. A weathered butter churn rests in one yard, while splintered shutters dangle precariously from the candlelit window of another nearby residence.

node.name: Dirge, Hawthorn Lane
node.description: The gnarled branches of the surrounding hawthorn trees overhang the area, creating a weblike canopy that shadows the end of the worn cobblestone lane. Bordering a partially collapsed riverstone barrier that once enclosed the nearby cemetary, a crude rack is hung with rusted shovels caked with dried mud. The bedraggled homes huddle together as if guarding from what lies beyond, their decayed fences missing a majority of the pickets which lie buried amid the tall, surrounding weeds. A single lamp post supports a battered lantern, providing minimal lighting in the dead of night.

node.name: Hawthorn Lane, Cemetery
node.description: An unsettling pall hangs over the desecrated cemetery at the end of the road. Fringed by a dense foreboding forest, freshly opened graves and defiled crypts have left their pilfered remains scattered about the area. Broken headstones and weather-worn bones are strewn across the dried, ash-covered scrub that grows sparsely over the area. A few discolored monuments still stand amid the depredation, looming in the darkness like malevolent guardians.

node.name: Lava Fields, Ruined Farmhouse
node.description: Charred and broken beams stand silent watch over this ruined farmstead. Undamaged roof tiles lie scattered about in untidy windrows. Amid the destruction and waste of what was once someone's home, the head of a child's doll pokes up from a mound of ash and melted rock. Blue painted eyes on a porcelain head stare mutely at you and ask questions no mortal can answer. If there was anything of value left here, it has long since been looted. Footprints in the dust lead north to the road.

node.name: Arthelun Flats, Oven of Cinders
node.description: The way north is clogged by a massive jumble of basalt bolders, many of them curiously hexagonal in form. A hot, keening wind screeches though a narrow crevice at the north end of this area, its harsh atonal voice rising and falling in volume and pitch with each gust. Volleys of ash and grit are flung unceasingly against anything impeding the wind, creating numerous, ever-changing dunes and drifts.

node.name: Arthelun Flats, Oven of Cinders
node.description: Cinders clog the passage here like drifts of sooty snow, making movement in any direction a perilous slog. A strong, hot wind from the northwest stirs the ash, carrying with it a sulfurous reek. High above, dark stalactites reach downward, their angular shapes suggesting roosting bats or massive sharks' teeth.

node.name: Arthelun Flats, Oven of Cinders
node.description: A narrow slice of sky is all that is visible of the outside world from inside this cramped volcanic fissure. Though wide enough for a large Gor'Tog to pass by, rocky prominences make passage this way difficult. A few tough lichens cling tenaciously to the undersides of a few stones their grey-green tones somewhat softening the pervasive sooty black.

node.name: Arthelun Flats, Oven of Cinders
node.description: A hot, dry wind howls through this enclosed space, catching the ubiquitous black grit and hurling it viciously into any object or creature blocking its passage. The air seems to shudder and moan like a despairing prisoner raging against a barred door.

node.name: Arthelun Flats, Oven of Cinders
node.description: Though shaded from above by a jagged overhang of slabbed volcanic rock, this spot is still terrifically hot. The sandy black soil is dry and gritty underfoot, strewn with rocks of all sizes, all combining to make the footing here extremely uncertain. No plants or animals are evident, despite the relative shelter from the winds and elements.

node.name: Arthelun Flats, Oven of Cinders
node.description: A large basalt slab stretches across the northeast edge of this spot, serving to muffle the unceasing gusts of wind and ash that pervade this area. High above, a hexagonal bit of the sky can be seen, this modest opening admitting a breath of moister, cooler air. The barest trickle of water decorates the basalt rocks in the lee of the slab, giving sustenance to a stunted sirese plant.

node.name: Arthelun Ruins, Back Chamber
node.description: Time and the collapse of the main building have obscured the purpose of this area. Now it is filled with a jumble of stones and debris, which fills the corners and divides the area into smaller open spaces.

node.name: Arthelun Ruins, Back Chamber
node.description: Little remains but a pile of rotting shelves to indicate the original function of the room. A few slabs from the ceiling have fallen onto the floor, their cracked and broken surfaces mute testimony to the forces that destoyed this building.

node.name: Arthelun Ruins, Back Chamber
node.description: A damp, musty smell wafts through the area, combining with the everpresent dust to create a haze in the air. Mold has crept up the walls from a tiny trickle of water that flows along the junction between the floor and the walls. The water disappears into a tiny crevice with a musical gurgle.

node.name: Dirge, Carousel Family Services
node.description: A series of guarded arches line the southern wall. The complicated framework of iron and timbers spans across the ceiling. Countless gears, pulleys and weights form the strikingly complex mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: Dirge, Rundmolen Post Office
node.description: Tucked up against the looming building is a low stone counter made from cut stone blocks. Vast, countless rows of differently sized shelves are behind the counter, and complex Dwarven mechanisms can be heard as they rearrange the package-covered storage. Clerks shuffle endlessly back and forth between the counters and shelving as they assist patrons with their packaging and mailing needs.
